type.name: Adventurer
type.benefit: Sleeps outside of the settlement. Protects the yearly settlement caravan, raising the return chance to 35%.

type.name: Armorer
type.benefit: Creates a workshop in the settlement. Allows the settlement to sell and repair armor.

type.name: Artist
type.benefit: Will only stay in the settlement if there's an Inn. Has a 3% chance of creating their magnum opus each week, which sells for d100x2d10 Bytes.

type.name: Bartender
type.benefit: Creates a tavern in the settlement. Gives the settlement's NPCs a place to unwind and get to know each other.

type.name: Beastlord
type.benefit: Will only stay in the settlement if it's in a forest. Sleeps outside of the settlement in the woods. Allows mounts to be sold within the settlement.

type.name: Butcher
type.benefit: Creates a butchershop in the settlement. Every year it generates enough resources to bring in another random NPC.

type.name: Cartographer
type.benefit: Creates an observatory in the settlement. Cartographers sell information on surrounding hexes for 5 Bytes. Cartographers have a 5% chance of creating a map to a legendary item every month.

type.name: Chaos Mage
type.benefit: Will only stay in town if there's a wizard tower but not a sage or a stormlord. Generates a lightning rod on the wizard tower that has a 5% chance of capturing a lightning bolt every month. A chaos mage will sell Bottled Lightning for 25 Bytes. When used, Bottled Lightning adds +20 to one Contest of your choic

type.name: Cleric
type.benefit: Creates a temple in the settlement. Temples celebrate the calendar's holidays, bringing their benefits to the settlement.

type.name: Diabolist
type.benefit: Will not stay in the settlement if there's a temple. Serves a random Archbug. Has a 10% chance of converting another NPC into a diabolist every week. If three diabolists live in a settlement, they create a temple to their Archbug, increasing the weekly conversion chance to 25%. If ten diabolists live in a settlement, their Archbug will arrive to convert the rest and corrupt the town, turning it into Glitch terrain.

type.name: Elementalist
type.benefit: Will only stay in the settlement if there's a wizard tower with a lightning rod. Increases the chance of catching a lightning bolt to 7%. Elementalists can convert captured lightning into a solar orb, which can cause an eclipse that day, even if there's already been one this month.

type.name: Enchanter
type.benefit: Creates a card shop in the settlement. Allows the settlement to sell foils.

type.name: Farmer
type.benefit: Creates a farm and a farmhouse in the settlement. Gives the settlement something to trade with nearby settlements. Every year there will be a caravan that goes out. There's a 25% chance it returns. If paired with a mine, increase the chance to 35%.

type.name: Fisherman
type.benefit: Creates a fishing hole and a shack on the outskirts of the settlement.

type.name: Healer
type.benefit: Will only stay in town if there's a temple. Heals status effects for 4 Bytes each. Heals injured NPCs over the course of a week

type.name: Innkeeper
type.benefit: Creates an Inn in the settlement. Roll on the traveling NPC table once each month.

type.name: Justicar
type.benefit: Will only stay in town if there's a temple and a healer. They will kill any diabolist in town. Justicars upgrade the temple to a Holy Monument which converts every NPC in the settlement to the same religion. Justicars defend towns from undead, making them immune to Zombie raids.

type.name: Knight
type.benefit: Creates a fort in the settlement and generates a knight NPC every month until there are six. When there are six knights, they generate a unique rare sword every month and offer it as a reward in the colosseum.

type.name: Leatherworker
type.benefit: Creates a tannery in the settlement. Every year it generates enough resources to bring in another random NPC.

type.name: Librarian
type.benefit: Creates a library in the settlement. Allows research to be done. If paired with a wizard tower, the research dice is increased to a d6.

type.name: Loremaster
type.benefit: Creates a wizard tower in the settlement. Allows research to be done. If paired with a library, the research dice is increased to a d6.

type.name: Mason
type.benefit: Creates a stonecutter's shop in the settlement. Cuts future construction times in half.

type.name: Mindmelder
type.benefit: Creates a reliquary unique to the settlement. Leaves after a month. If the reliquary is taken into a mine within the same settlement, it will reveal a dungeon entrance that holds a legendary item.

type.name: Miner
type.benefit: Creates a mine in the settlement. Gives the settlement something to trade with nearby settlements. Every year there will be a caravan that goes out. There's a 25% chance it returns. If paired with a farm, increase the chance to 35%

type.name: Necromancer
type.benefit: Will only stay in the settlement if there's a temple. Grants +3 to all rolls against undead while in the settlement. Has a 1% chance of resurrecting any NPC that dies in the settlement.

type.name: Ranger
type.benefit: Will not stay in the settlement unless there's a defense tower. Increase all fishing rolls by +1. For every Ranger in a settlement, there's a 10% chance a legendary animal spawns in an adjacent hex.

type.name: Reaver
type.benefit: Will only stay in the settlement if it's on a coast, or adjacent to a river. Adds a dock and a pirate ship to the settlement. Pirate ships allow pets to be sold at settlements.

type.name: Sage
type.benefit: Will only stay in town if there's a wizard tower but not a Chaos Mage or a Storm Lord. Can identify magic items and will buy magic items if negotiated with. Can also recharge teleportation circles.

type.name: Shadow Priest
type.benefit: Will only stay in the settlement if it's adjacent to a forest hex. All adjacent forest hexes are turned into Black Forest. Only one Black Forest can exist on Annwn at a time. Black Forests spawn Shadow Skeletons and hold a legendary item.

type.name: Shepherd
type.benefit: Creates a farmhouse in the settlement. Every year it generates enough resources to bring in another random NPC.

type.name: Soldier
type.benefit: Grants +1 to all combat rolls against hostile mobs inside of a settlement.

type.name: Spirit Warden
type.benefit:
Will only stay in town if there's a card shop in the settlement. Offers tarot readings once a week. Roll d6 to see your fortune:
1-2. Castle - “You will defend yourself against all odds.” +1 to your Defense for the week.
3-4. Spider - “You will go where you please, even where you aren't wanted.” +2 to Stealth for the week.
5-6. Joker - “There is great fortune in your near future.” Gain twice as many Bytes for the rest of the day.

type.name: Stormlord
type.benefit: Will only stay in the settlement if there is a wizard tower but there isn't a Chaos Mage. Generates a lightning rod on the wizard tower that has a 5% chance of capturing a lightning bolt each month. The stormlord crafts them into arrows of slaying, which they sell for 50 Bytes each. Arrows of Slaying auto-destroy the rest of their target's dice if they lose the Contest.

type.name: Toolsmith
type.benefit: Creates a hardware store in the settlement. Allows the settlement to sell equipment

type.name: Town Guard
type.benefit: Creates a warden's office in the settlement. Has a 10% chance of having a traveling NPC in the barracks every month

type.name: Unemployed
type.benefit: Can be trained and taken as apprentices to other jobs. Unemployed NPCs will also adventure with Player Characters for 2 Bytes per day. NPCs who go on adventures have a 10% chance at becoming adventurers themselves, though that means they'll leave the settlement.

type.name: Warlord
type.benefit: Will only stay in town if there are four defense towers. Generates a soldier NPC every month.

type.name: Weaponsmith
type.benefit: Creates a blacksmith in the settlement. Allows the settlement to sell weapons.
